description: Like flies to…

title: Not Boeing Anywhere
description: Zeno sees if consulting for the airline industry will fly.

title: Starch Enemies
description: U-Gene bites off more than he can chew.

title: Board to Death
description: Zeno shows us the importance of keeping track of things.

title: A Smashing Success!
description: Zeno zaps a Democrat congressman and turns him into the Blue Hulk.

title: Kondo Minimum
description: U-Gene gets rid of all of Zeno's stuff that doesn't spark joy.

title: RTFM
description: When U-Gene has a tech issue, Zeno's IT robot is remarkably unhelpful.

title: Not the Droid You're Looking For
description: With apologies to George Lucas.

title: Pacifying the President
description: Zeno invents a toy border wall to calm Trump's tantrums.

title: An X-Mas Visit from a Man in Red
description: Donald Trump is sad and alone on Christmas when he gets a visit from a very special man in red.

title: Puke-ular Escalation
description: U-Gene doesn't care about Trump's divisive rhetoric until it comes for his wallet.

title: Much-Needed Input
description: Zeno invents a USB keyboard designed for right-wing crazies.

title: Comic Strips
description: Zeno and Dijon the Armadmillo are torn through a paper shredder a la Banksy's Sotheby's auction performance art.

title: Gone Bad
description: Zeno's genetically modified avocados become self-aware and wreak havok in the lab.

title: Voting Time!
description: Zeno takes U-Gene on an adventure through time to teach him the importance of voting.

title: Party Animals
description: Zeno provides tips on how to push back on the cruelty of the Republican party.

title: Unless Round is Funny
description: Zeno explores the hidden meaning of Donald Trump's mysterious Saudi glowing orb.

title: Oh Snap, That's Cold!
description: U-Gene learns the hard way that climate change is, in fact, real.

title: Kernel Panic
description: U-Gene freaks out thinking he's gotten ransomware, when really it's just Symantec trying to upgrade him to premium.

title: We Deliver for You!
description: U-Gene realizes the US Postal Service's Informed Delivery email feature is a novel new way to receive more junk mail.

title: All About My Mother
description: U-Gene wishes his mother was Helen Mirren.

title: Useful Euphemisms
description: Zeno educates us on the underlying meaning of phrases like Cultural Anxiety and encourages us to call it what it is.

title: Double-o-Duck
description: Secret agent Double-o-Duck pays the lab a visit.

title: Psyyyych!
description: Zeno explains the Republican party's apparent lack of empathy.

title: Extraterrestrial Inelegants
description: Roswell and Grey, two clueless extraterrestrial visitors, land nearby the lab.

title: The Technicolor Yawn
description: U-Gene tries to take on Starbucks Unicorn Frappuccino business, but instead ends up vomiting rainbows.

title: Beep Bip Bop Boop
description: This comic is delivered using QR Codes. Use your mobile device to visit each panel's URL.

title: An Irresistable Force
description: The guys at the lab get sucked into the trailer for Star Wars: The Last Jedi.

title: The Coming Plague
description: Zeno invents the Passover Seder of the future.

title: Shooting His Mouth Off
wiki: American-led intervention in the Syrian civil war
description: Zeno outfits his Trump Robot with cruise missiles.

title: Miss Information
description: Dijon the Armadillo discovers his virtual assistant is not everything it seems.

title: Illegal Bracketeering
wiki: NCAA Division I Men's Basketball Tournament

title: Uber Disgusting
markdown: When Portland, Oregon officials were investigating whether Uber was operating within the law, they were [reportedly](https://www.latimes.com/business/technology/la-fi-tn-uber-greyball-20170303-story.html) shown a fake version of the app in an effort to hinder their work, a practice known internally as "greyballing." Naturally, having the brain of a 9-year-old, I couldn't resist.

title: Foiled Again
wiki: Allegations of Obama spying on Trump

title: Hysteria Repeats Itself
wiki: The Man in the High Castle (TV series)

title: Operation Coin-Op
markdown: Commander-in-Chief Trump ain't interested in any of that *For All Mankind* kumbaya shit. His [Space Force](https://www.nytimes.com/2018/06/18/us/politics/trump-space-force-sixth-military-branch.html)  will DOMINATE the universe with his brand of toxic masculinity, over-compensation for tiny hands, and aversion to even attemp to understand how things work.

title: Scott Pruitt Didn't Doitt
markdown: Trump's EPA chief Scott Pruitt [reportedly](https://www.cnn.com/2018/04/06/politics/scott-pruitt-controversies-list/index.html) had his security detail drive him around looking for lotion from D.C.-area Ritz-Carltons, had a staffer reach out to the Trump Hotel to purchase one of their mattresses, and hit up oil and gas companies for tickets to the Rose Bowl. But of course there's a logical explanation for all that, since we all know he was too focused on his job.

title: I'm Down with Covfefe
markdown: Covfefe (/koʊˈfɛfi/ koh-FEH-fee) is a misspelling, widely presumed to be a typo, that Donald Trump used in a viral tweet when he was U.S. President. It instantly became an Internet meme. —[Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Covfefe)

title: More Fun than a Barrel of Sea Monkeys!
Trump gets Eclipsed
markdown: Trump celebrates solar eclipse by looking up without special viewing glasses. [Washingtion Post August 21, 2017](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-fix/wp/2017/08/21/trump-celebrates-solar-eclipse-by-looking-up-without-special-viewing-glasses/)

title: Drawing a Blank
wiki: North Korea and weapons of mass destruction

title: Pardon Me?
wiki: Federal pardons in the United States
markdown: Trump [reportedly](https://www.npr.org/2021/01/09/955087860/can-trump-pardon-himself) asked aides whether a President can pardon oneself. I suppose he was asking for a friend.

title: Droning On
markdown: When Google failed to secure a lucritive Pentagon contract due to their [pesky employees' standards of ethics](https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-switch/wp/2018/06/01/google-to-drop-pentagon-ai-contract-after-employees-called-it-the-business-of-war/), Zeno, who has no such standards, cashes in.

title: Say Hello to my Little Friend
wiki: Gun politics in the United States

title: I'd Like to Tank the Academy
Loyaly has its Discords
markdown: It always amazed me how people stay loyal to Trump even as he publicly humiliates them. I wonder, what dirt he must have had on Jeff Sessions to keep his Attorney General puckering up despite the [well-documented verbal abuse](https://www.cnn.com/2018/02/28/politics/donald-trump-jeff-sessions-feud/index.html)?

title: Kicking Back in the Gun Lobby
wiki: Gun politics in the United States

title: An Unlikely Sponsor
description: It turns out this comic strip is sponsored by Garfield. Who knew?

title: An iPhone Walks Into a Bar
description: U-Gene finds an iPhone 4 prototype in bar in Redwood City.

title: Hololens '95
description: U-Gene experiences the Microsoft Hololens for the first time.

title: Watch Where We're Going
description: In response to self-driving cars, Zeno invents self-walking pedestrians. Hilarity ensues.

title: Worn Out
description: U-Gene gets an Apple Tongue Ring.

title: Smögvergnügen
description: U-Gene's jetpack is recalled by the EPA.

title: Only Half Joking
description: Zeno brings a half-dead cat to the lab.

title: Proxy Battle
description: Zeno leaves a proxy robot with the lab to watch over things while he's gone.

title: Knot Your Mother's Girl Scouts
description: U-Gene greatly underestimates Zeno's niece Petra.

title: Fringe Binge
description: Zeno erases U-Gene's memory so that he can enjoy Stranger Things Season One all over again.

title: B-Lab J-School
description: Zeno explains the concept of False Balance, also known as bothsidesism, in which journalists present an issue as being more balanced between opposing viewpoints than the evidence supports.

title: Zeno's App of the Week
description: Zeno builds an app that tells us how the world will end.

title: Augmented Surreality
description: U-Gene goes down the Pokemon rabbit hole.

title: Water You Worried About?
description: U-Gene gets a notice from the water district congratulating him for saving water.

title: STEM the Ignorance
description: When meeting Zeno's technically-minded niece, U-Gene's sexist attitudes bubble to the surface.

title: Why Am I Dredding This
description: Zeno suggests an unusual nominee for the Supreme Court vacancy left by Antonin Scalia.

title: Patent No. US-20220051503-A1
markdown:
**Exercise your right to vote — without all the exercise!**

**Here's how it works:** When inexplicably undecided voter **(A)** views last-minute campaign ads **(B)**, emotional responses are gathered via electrode cap **(C)**. Microcomputer **(D)** translates results into motor-impulse signals, which are sent via transmitter **(E)** to brain of trained gibbon **(F)**. Voila! You've been spared the discomfort often associated with making decisions.

title: Patent No. US-11252952-B2
markdown:
**Remove Lame-Duck President In One Fowl Swoop**

**Here's how it works:** When chief executive signs last-minute pardons, scale **(A) ** tips, lifting cover off Hillary Clinton's superior cookies **(B)**. Angered, Barbara reaches for her spatula **(C)**, tugging typewriter **(D)** away from Millie who is scribing her tell-all autobiography *How I Ran the Presidency Without Even Getting a Biscuit.* Millie rushes for the typewriter, causing leash **(E)** to pull trap-door lever **(F)**, sending George Bush into a bottomless pit of obscurity where Reagan, Carter, Ford and Nixon await him.

title: No One Can Hear You Scream
The Clone Wars
description: Zeno clones 40 million fruit flies to comedic effect
